segments.text: I'm planning to buy a bicycle . As you are quite a cycling enthusiast , I wish you might give me some advice .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: With pleasure , chap . But before I start , I need to know what you want a bike for ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My purposes are two-fold . On the one hand , I've grown bored of commuting on suffocating buses every day and decided to ride to work . On the other hand , bicycling is a sport , and I intend to build up my body through constantly taking a ride over the weekends .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Cycling during weekends ? Do you me riding on the mountainous countryside just the neighboring towns ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Can't be greater . If you ride on bumpy , hilly roads , a mountain bike is what you need . But if you just ride comfortably along the city lanes , you might choose a road bike .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: A road bike features skinny tires and a light-weight frame . Its riding position puts you bent over the handlebars . It's not particularly beefy in construction , and generally , it won't stand up well under heavy loads or on really rough surfaces . In contrast , mountain bikes have wide tires and a stout frame . You sit higher on them and don't have to hunched over .
